title: Indian Culture 101
description: Test your knowledge of India's diverse cultural landscape, from famous dances and textiles to regional festivals.

culturalMatchUp.title: Cultural Match-Up
culturalMatchUp.instruction: Match the cultural item to its correct state of origin.

factOrFiction.title: Fact or Fiction?
factOrFiction.instruction: Read the three statements and identify the one that is FICTION.

statements.text: The game of Snakes and Ladders originated in India.
India has the world's largest postal network.
India is the only country where both lions and tigers are found in the wild.
The number zero was invented in India.
The national sport of India is Hockey.
statements.explanation: India does not have an official national sport.

statements.text: Shampooing is an Indian concept.
India has never hosted the Olympic Games.
The world's highest cricket ground is in India.
The official language of India is Hindi.
statements.explanation: India has no single national language. Hindi and English are official languages for government work.

statements.text: The game of Chess originated in India.
The Himalayas are the oldest mountain range in the world.
statements.explanation: The Himalayas are among the youngest mountain ranges.

statements.text: The 'Great Indian Bustard' is a bird found in India.
India is the world's largest producer of milk.
The Bengal Tiger is India's national animal.
All Indian currency notes have a picture of the Taj Mahal.
statements.explanation: They feature Mahatma Gandhi and various monuments, but not exclusively the Taj Mahal.

statements.text: The first university in the world was established in Taxila.
India has a coastline that is over 10,000 kilometers long.
statements.explanation: India's coastline is approximately 7,517 kilometers long.

statements.text: Ayurveda is a system of medicine with historical roots in India.
The Indian film industry, Bollywood, is the largest in the world by number of films produced.
The Republic of India is the world's largest democracy.
All states in India have the same official language.
The Indus Valley Civilization is one of the world's oldest urban civilizations.
The Indian Peacock is the national bird of India.
The Ganges is the longest river that flows entirely within India.
statements.explanation: The Godavari River is the longest river that is entirely within India's borders.

statements.text: Rabindranath Tagore was the first non-European to win a Nobel Prize in Literature.
The Indian Rupee is the only currency accepted in India.
statements.explanation: While it's the official currency, some tourist areas may accept foreign currency, though it's not the norm.

statements.text: The banyan tree is the national tree of India.
The 'Cataract surgery' was first performed by the Indian physician Sushruta.
The concept of 'pi' (π) was first calculated in India.
India shares a border with China, Pakistan, and Russia.
statements.explanation: India does not share a border with Russia.

statements.text: The Kumbh Mela is a Hindu pilgrimage that is the largest peaceful gathering in the world.
All 28 states of India are located on the mainland.
statements.explanation: States like Andaman & Nicobar Islands are not on the mainland.

statements.text: The Lotus is the national flower of India.
India was the first country to develop the technique of extracting and purifying sugar.
The Indian subcontinent is home to 4 of the world's 36 biodiversity hotspots.
The President of India lives in the Taj Mahal.
The 'binary number system' was developed in ancient India.
India has the most post offices in the world.
statements.explanation: This is a common myth; while India has a huge network, it is not the largest.

statements.text: The capital of India, New Delhi, is the country's most populous city.
statements.explanation: Mumbai is the most populous city in India.

statements.text: Yoga has its origins in ancient India.
The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) successfully launched a mission to Mars on its first attempt.
Mount Everest is located entirely within India's borders.
statements.explanation: It is located on the border of Nepal and China.

statements.text: The mango is the national fruit of India.
The Indian national anthem was composed by Mahatma Gandhi.
statements.explanation: It was composed by Rabindranath Tagore.

statements.text: The largest spice market in Asia is located in Delhi.
The concept of 'plastic surgery' is mentioned in ancient Indian texts.
India has the largest number of vegetarians in the world.
All parts of India experience a tropical climate.
statements.explanation: India has a diverse range of climates, including alpine in the Himalayas.

statements.text: The decimal system was developed in India.
India is a monarchy ruled by a king.
statements.explanation: India is a parliamentary democratic republic.

statements.text: The world's largest film studio complex is in India.
The river Ganges is considered sacred by Hindus.
The 'Taj Mahal' is a palace where the Mughal emperor lived.
The Indian flag is known as the 'Tiranga'.
The martial art Kalaripayattu originated in South India.
India is the largest country in the world by land area.
statements.explanation: India is the 7th largest country by land area.

statements.text: The 'Stepwells' are a unique architectural feature found in India.
The state of Meghalaya is known for its 'living root bridges'.
All Indian citizens are required to speak English.
The 'Ganges river dolphin' is India's national aquatic animal.
